links.title: U.S. Stocks Rebound as Trump Tweets He'd Consider Limited Stimulus Measures
links.description: U.S. stocks rebounded after President Donald Trump said he would consider limited stimulus measures. The upswing came a day after he shocked financial markets by calling off negotiations with Democrats until after the election. On Tuesday, the Dow tumbled 375 points, or 1.3%, while the S&P 500 fell 1.4% and the Nasdaq dropped 1.6% after Trump announced he would pause stimulus talks.

$SIRI Howard Stern Says Sirius Deal Isn’t Imminent, But ‘I’ll Take It’ 

https://newsfilter.io/a/11ae65c299d99349b97c0a7ab0a7a7a3

links.title: Howard Stern Says Sirius Deal Isn't Imminent, But 'I'll Take It'
links.description: Satellite-radio star Howard Stern told listeners Wednesday morning that he isn't yet close to a new contract with Sirius XM Holdings, but he said the reported figures he's heard sounded good to him.

messages.body: ($SIRI) – The satellite radio operator is close to signing a new deal with Howard Stern which would pay the radio host about $120 million per year, according to sources who spoke to Bloomberg. Sirius XM also announced a 10% dividend increase. Additionally, Credit Suisse upgraded the stock to “outperform” from “neutral,” based on what it calls “surprisingly” better-than-expected results.

$SIRI was analyzed by 13 analysts. The buy consensus is at 91%. So analysts seem to be very confident about $SIRI. https://www.chartmill.com/stock/quote/SIRI/analyst-ratings?utm_source=stocktwits&utm_medium=ANALYST&utm_content=SIRI&utm_campaign=social_tracking

links.description: Stocks tried to shake off Tuesday's losses in premarket trading, following a series of seemingly conflicting tweets from President Donald Trump. On Tuesday, Trump tweeted that he instructed his representatives to stop negotiating with Democrats over a stimulus package until after the election.

messages.body:
$SIRI Sirius should be bought with Stern deal 'potentially derisked,' says B. Riley
B. Riley Securities analyst Zack Silver keeps a Buy rating on Sirius XM with a $7.50 price target after Bloomberg reported that the company is close to a renewal with Howard Stern in what would likely be another multi-year exclusive deal. Despite significantly outperforming initial COVID-related adjustments to expectations, the shares have declined 22% year-to-date, Silver tells investors in a research note. The analyst believes concerns around a successful renewal with Stern, exacerbated by Spotify's march into non-music exclusives, has driven some of the pressure in the stock.
$SIRI Joe Rogan > Howard $SPOT

$SIRI Sirius XM declares $0.014641 dividend, an increase of ~10%
Oct. 06, 2020 6:02 PM ETSirius XM Holdings Inc. (SIRI)By: Akanksha Bakshi, SA News Editor
Sirius XM (NASDAQ:SIRI) declares $0.014641/share quarterly dividend, 9.7% increase from prior dividend of $0.01331.
Forward yield 1.05%
Payable Nov. 30; for shareholders of record Nov. 6; ex-div Nov. 5.
